greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: XOR BINOMIAL transform of A038712.
comment: See A099884 for the definitions of the XOR BINOMIAL transform and the XOR difference triangle.
A038712 has offset 1, but we need to use offset 0 for the XOR BINOMIAL. - _Michael Somos_, Dec 30 2016
formula: a(2^n-1) = 2^n for n>=0 and a(k)=0 otherwise. a(n) = SumXOR_{i=0..n} (C(n, i)mod 2)*A038712(n-i) and SumXOR is summation under XOR.
example: XOR difference triangle of A038712 begins:
where A038712 is in the leftmost column and A099894 (this sequence) forms the main diagonal.
a(1) = 1*1 XOR 0*1 = 1, a(2) = 1*1 XOR 0*3 XOR 1*1 = 0, a(3) = 1*1 XOR 1*3 XOR 1*1 XOR 1*7 = 4 where (1, 3, 1, 7) are the first four terms of A038712. - _Michael Somos_, Dec 30 2016
mathematica: a[ n_] := With[ {m = n+1}, If[ m >=0 && Total[ IntegerDigits[ m, 2]] == 1, m, 0]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Dec 30 2016 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(m = n+1); m * ( m>=0 && hammingweight(m) == 1)}; /* _Michael Somos_, Dec 30 2016 */
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Oct 29 2004
